intro: Jacksonia ulicina, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, strap-like leaves that are often used in traditional Māori weaving. Jacksonia ulicina is adapted to coastal environments and thrives in well-drained soils. It plays an important ecological role in New Zealand's native flora.
